title: delete unwanted form fill data
content:
Security issue with form filler data -- LSS, I have some very unwanted saved data somewhere in some buffer area of the browser that I want to surgically remove.

I currently have firefox set to offer to save logins, and not to fill in addresses or credit cards. I have indicated, when offered, to "never save" logins from certain sites. I have gone to the saved logins area in firefox and verified that the login information is not saved there. However when I go to a site, the login information is in the browser somewhere and shows up under the form blank as I type the correct information in. Obviously this is a security issue. I once got rid of this data by deleting EVERYTHING but of course I lost a lot in the process. The first time I did that I hadn't fully configured the settings for form filler so I hoped for better the second time around. But no, alas and alack it is back. I am hoping someone out there knows how I can go in and surgically remove this data.

NOTE I have already tried every solution in the firefox help area and in the firefox forums and on all help sites on the first ten pages of google so PLEASE do not fill up the answer area telling me to try that stuff. It did not work. The only thing that worked was deleting EVERYTHING (Ctrl+shift+del clear everything for all time) I have spent hours on trying different things because 1) these logins should not be saved and 2) I don't want to delete everything again 3) I didn't want to have to write this essay here.

TLDR Alternately if you know how I can export and then import my cookies and site settings, I could delete EVERYTHING and then add those 2 back in. THANK YOU fellow campers!
creator: aUserNamed

title: Cannot update 32-bit esr to 64-bit on W10pro
content:
W10 Pro (sys info & TS info are below) I run both w/32-bit 91.4.1 esr & 64-bit 95.0.2 on the same machine. I tried to manually upgrade the esr to 64-bit but am told 'unable - system incompatible' and get the W XP & Vista support ended at 52.9...I'm running 32-bit 91.4 AND 64-bit . Help me understand if/what is incompatible so I can manually push my esr to 64-bit. Getting to 64-bit from 32 (per help page) says to just download and run the 64-bit ESR setup.exe. That fails...same issue...incompatible. FF setup thinks my OS isn't W10 Pro....so does the ESR FF 'application menu'...and the TS info. My ESR is set as the default browser app. AND I don't have any (known) issue with the 64-bit 95.0.2 Advice? Do I need to uninstall the 32-bit esr strangely I am already running 91.4.1 32-bit esr...says HELP/about.??? I'd like to know what esr is actually running...I presume 32-bit. Thx, wgk

Sys Info HP Z400 ---> Edition Windows 10 Pro Version 21H1 Installed on ‎8/‎25/‎2020 OS build 19043.1415 Experience Windows Feature Experience Pack 120.2212.3920.0

Device name ##### Processor Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU W3520 @ 2.67GHz 2.66 GHz Installed RAM 18.0 GB --> System type 64-bit operating system, x64-based processor Pen and touch No pen or touch input is available for this display

title: Firefox won't remember certain settings on websites
content:
Recently my firefox started forgetting certain settings on certain website. Like Twitch... It will remember that I am logged in, BUT it keeps reverting to light mode, and i have to agree that some streamers stream with adult language EVERY time. On Reddit, again it remembers that I am logged in, BUT it forgets all my previous searches. On HBO, it completely forgets my login and i have to agree to the cookies EVERY single time. On Imgur, again it forgets everything.

Then again on Google, it remembers everything all the time.

I also want to point out that this was not a problem a few months ago. also that chrome and even edge dont have this problem.

I have tried to "refresh" firefox, even completely uninstalled it, and re-installed. same problem.

It's getting really annoying, and chrome is seeming like the better browser every day now.

title: Keyboard Shortcuts on Canva
content:
Dear Mozilla Firefox developers,

Since my Firefox was updated to the latest version, I have been having some difficulties using keyboard shortcuts on Canva (online design platform).

When I use Canva for a few minutes on Firefox, keyboard shortcuts don't work such as Copy (Ctrl + C), Paste (Ctrl +V), Cut (Ctrl + X) and (Ctrl + Z). I have to restart my Mozilla to make it work again but it doesn't take long to repeat the problem.

I never had such problems before Firefox update. To make sure if that is not a Canva or Windows 11 error, I used Canva on Google Chrome but never had the same problem. Sometimes when I try to copy a text, it changes the alignment of text instead of copying the text. I have also contacted Canva Support Team and they confirmed there's nothing wrong on their side.

As a designer, I use Canva frequently. Mozilla Firefox is my favourite browser but I will have to stop using it if you cannot find any solution for that. I tried to reset my Mozilla completely but it didn't work.

Is that a common problem that you are working on it?

Thank you in advance. I look forward to hearing from you.

title: Vuhuv arama motoru sorunu
content: Selamlar. Ben bilgisayarımda pardus kullanıyorum. Ve firefox esr (91.4.1esr (64 bit)) sürümü yüklü. Vuhuv sitesinin "Arama Motoru Yap" (https://tr.vuhuv.com/?k=0&p=1&d=1&q=arama+motorun+yap) sayfasındaki talimatlara göre hareket ediyorum ancak varsayılan arama motorlarında çıkan listede "vuhuv" bir türlü çıkmıyor. "Esr" olmayan sürümde ise sorunsuz olarak "vuhuv" varsayılan arama motoru eklenebilmektedir. İlgili sayfanın ekran görüntüsünü gönderiyorum. Yardımcı olabilirseniz çok memnun olurum. All the best

Simone
